publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1206 Ted Brocklebank: Congratulations to AL Kennedy—That the Parliament congratulates Dundee-born writer and former lecturer in creative writing at the University of St Andrews, (Alison) AL Kennedy, on winning this year’s prestigious Costa Book of the Year Award for her fifth novel, Day; notes that the novel triumphed over the books of established authors such as Simon Sebag Montefiore, and endorses the words of the chair of the final judges, Joanna Trollope, that "Day is an example of excellence in its category and a book ultimately to recommend. It is perfectly and beautifully written by an author who is an extraordinary stylist."

S3M-1206 Congratulations to AL Kennedy (lodged on 23 January 2008) Patricia Ferguson*, Patrick Harvie*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*, Alex Neil*, Mary Scanlon*, Margaret Mitchell*, Murdo Fraser*, Alasdair Allan*, Karen Gillon*, Brian Adam*, Bashir Ahmad*, Rob Gibson*, Stuart McMillan*, Elizabeth Smith*, Jamie Stone*, Hugh Henry*, John Lamont*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Cathy Peattie*, Jamie McGrigor*, Nanette Milne*, Jamie Hepburn*, Sandra White*, Kenneth Gibson*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Malcolm Chisholm*

S3M-1206 Ted Brocklebank: Congratulations to AL Kennedy—That the Parliament congratulates Dundee-born writer and former lecturer in creative writing at the University of St Andrews, (Alison) AL Kennedy, on winning this year’s prestigious Costa Book of the Year Award for her fifth novel, Day; notes that the novel triumphed over the books of established authors such as Simon Sebag Montefiore, and endorses the words of the chair of the final judges, Joanna Trollope, that "Day is an example of excellence in its category and a book ultimately to recommend. It is perfectly and beautifully written by an author who is an extraordinary stylist."
